member.name: T:Atropos.IImmutableDeque`1
member.summary: Represents an immutable Deque - i.e. the two-ended queue that supports push/pop operations from both ends with an amortized cost ot O(1) per operation.

member.summary: Adds the specified key/value pairs to the immutable dictionary.

member.returns: A new immutable dictionary that contains the additional key/value pairs.

member.name: M:Atropos.ImmutableDictionary`2.SetItem(`0,`1)
member.summary: Sets the specified key and value to the dictionary, possibly overwriting an existing value for the given key.
member.param: The key of the entry to add.
The value of the entry to add.
member.returns: The new dictionary containing the additional key-value pair.
member.remarks: If the given key-value pair are already in the dictionary, the existing instance is returned. If the key already exists but with a different value, a new instance with the overwritten value will be returned.

member.name: M:Atropos.ImmutableDictionary`2.SetItems(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.Collections.Generic.KeyValuePair{`0,`1}})
member.summary: Applies a given set of key=value pairs to an immutable dictionary, replacing any conflicting keys in the resulting dictionary.
member.param: The key=value pairs to set on the dictionary. Any keys that conflict with existing keys will overwrite the previous values.
member.returns: An immutable dictionary.

member.summary: Retrieves an empty immutable dictionary.
member.returns: An empty immutable dictionary.

member.name: M:Atropos.ImmutableDictionary`2.Remove(`0)
member.summary: Removes the specified key from the dictionary with its associated value.
member.param: The key to remove.
member.returns: A new dictionary with the matching entry removed; or this instance if the key is not in the dictionary.

member.summary: Removes the specified keys from the dictionary with their associated values.
member.param: The keys to remove.
member.returns: A new dictionary with those keys removed; or this instance if those keys are not in the dictionary.

member.summary: Determines whether this immutable dictionary contains the specified key/value pair.

member.returns: true if the specified key/value pair is found in the dictionary; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Atropos.ImmutableDictionary`2.ContainsKey(`0)
member.summary: Determines whether the immutable dictionary contains an element with the specified key.
member.param: The key to locate.
member.returns: true if the immutable dictionary contains an element with the specified key; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Atropos.ImmutableDictionary`2.GetEnumerator
member.summary: Returns an enumerator that iterates through the immutable dictionary.
member.returns: An enumerator that can be used to iterate through the dictionary.

member.name: M:Atropos.ImmutableDictionary`2.TryGetValue(`0,`1@)
member.summary: Searches the dictionary for the value by the given key.
member.param: The key.
The value.
member.returns: A value indicating whether the search was successful.

member.name: M:Atropos.ImmutableDictionary`2.TryGetKey(`0,`0@)
member.summary: Searches the dictionary for a given key and returns the equal key it finds, if any.
member.param: The key to search for.
The key from the dictionary that the search found, or if the search yielded no match.
member.returns: A value indicating whether the search was successful.
member.remarks: This can be useful when you want to reuse a previously stored reference instead of a newly constructed one (so that more sharing of references can occur) or to look up the canonical value, or a value that has more complete data than the value you currently have, although their comparer functions indicate they are equal.

member.name: M:Atropos.ImmutableList.Add``2(Atropos.ImmutableList{``0},``1)
member.summary: Makes a copy of the list, and adds the specified to the end of the copied list.
member.typeparam: Type of the original list items
Type of the value to add
member.param: Original list
The object to add to the list
member.returns: A new list with the object added
member.remarks: Warning: the operation asymptotic is O(.Count), as we have to clone the list. Reusing the nodes of the original list is impossible due to the limitations of the C# type system: Node<> cannot be made covariant, and storing INode<> would kill the performance due to the indirect call.
